item.title: Karen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Presume not that I am the thing I was." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Had I the heavens' embroidered cloths, Enwrought with golden and silver light, The blue and the dim and the dark cloths Of night and light and the half light, I would spread the cloths under your feet: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "For after all, the best thing one can do when it is raining is let it rain." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Karen add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Pardon My Sanity In A World Insane" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I don't profess to be profound; but I do lay claim to common sense." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Emily Dickenson
item.description: "They might not need me; but they might. I'll let my head be just in sight; A smile as small as mine might be Precisely their necessity." -- Emily Dickenson

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description:
"I wandered lonely as a cloud That floats on high o'er vales and hills, When all at once I saw a crowd, A host, of golden daffodils; Beside the lake, beneath the trees, Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.
Continuous as the stars that shine And twinkle on the milky way, They stretched in never-ending line Along the margin of a bay: Ten thousand saw I at a glance, Tossing their heads in sprightly dance.
The waves beside them danced; but they Out-did the sparkling waves in glee: A poet could not but be gay, In such a jocund company: I gazed--and gazed--but little thought What wealth the show to me had brought:
For oft, when on my couch I lie In vacant or in pensive mood, They flash upon that inward eye Which is the bliss of solitude; And then my heart with pleasure fills, And dances with the daffodils." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Karen add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Not in entire forgetfulness, And not in utter nakedness, But trailing clouds of glory do we come From God, who is our home." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Karen add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no oneâ€™s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Karen add a quote by ROBERT FROST
item.description: "I am not a teacher, but an awakener." -- ROBERT FROST

item.title: Karen add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious - the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I thought of that while riding my bicycle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is to not stop questioning." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jenkin Lloyd Jones
item.description: "Anyone who imagines that bliss is normal is going to waste a lot of time running around shouting that he has been robbed. The fact is that most putts donâ€™t drop, most beef is tough, most children grow up to be just like people, most successful marriages require a high degree of mutual toleration, and most jobs are more often dull than otherwise. Life is just like an old time rail journey ... delays, sidetracks, smoke, dust, cinders, and jolts, interspersed only occasionally by beautiful vistas and thrilling bursts of speed. The trick is to thank the Lord for letting you have the ride." -- Jenkin Lloyd Jones

item.title: Karen add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Stop seeking out the storms and enjoy more fully the sunlight." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Karen add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Cultivate an attitude of happiness. Cultivate a spirit of optimism. Walk with faith, rejoicing in the beauties of nature, in the goodness of those you love, in the testimony which you carry in your heart concerning things divine." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Karen add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Go forward in life with a twinkle in your eye and a smile on your face, but with great purpose in heart." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Karen add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "In all of living, have much fun and laughter. Life is to be enjoyed, not just endured." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Karen add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "I feel to invite women everywhere to rise to the great potential within you. I do not ask that you reach beyond your capacity. I hope you will not nag yourselves with thoughts of failure. I hope you will not try to set goals far beyond your capacity to achieve. I hope you will simply do what you can do in the best way you know. If you do so, you will witness miracles come to pass." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Karen add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Work will work when wishy washy wishing won't." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am excessively diverted. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "She is tolerable, but not handsome enough to tempt me, and I am in no humor at present to give consequence to young ladies who are slighted by other men." -- Jane Austen
